alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 8:51AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Patchy Freezing Drizzle Remains Possible in the Broader Valleys... Patchy freezing drizzle is being observed within the Champlain Valley and St. Lawrence Valley. It appears likely that this will persist the next couple hours. Light ice accretion has occurred on elevated surfaces at the Patrick Leahy Burlington International Airport, and several traffic accidents are being reported. If road surfaces appear wet this morning, it may actually be a thin glaze of ice. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... Light freezing precipitation may quickly coat roadways with a thin layer of ice that may be undetectable. Please use extreme caution...especially on bridges...overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton
